cnd23:1.1: <em>151 : In terms of taste, not being a greedy person,
cnd23:1.2: A person who is not desiring, a person who does not nurture others,
cnd23:1.3: A second-time beggar (not skipping houses), not restrained to any family,
cnd23:1.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:1.5: <em>151 : In terms of taste, not being a greedy person,
cnd23:1.6: A person who is not desiring, a person who does not nurture others,
cnd23:1.7: A second-time beggar (not skipping houses), not restrained to any family,
cnd23:1.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:1.9: <em>151 : In terms of taste, not being a greedy person,
cnd23:1.10: A person who is not desiring, a person who does not nurture others,
cnd23:1.11: A second-time beggar (not skipping houses), not restrained to any family,
cnd23:1.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:1.13: <em>151 : In terms of taste, not being a greedy person,
cnd23:1.14: A person who is not desiring, a person who does not nurture others,
cnd23:1.15: A second-time beggar (not skipping houses), not restrained to any family,
cnd23:1.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:2.1: "In terms of taste, one who is not greedy or desiring": "Taste," there are root,
cnd23:2.2: branch, skin, leaf, flower, fruit, sour, sweet, bitter, spicy, salty, alkaline,
cnd23:2.3: astringent, pleasant, unpleasant, cold, and hot. Some Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇas are
cnd23:2.4: greedy for taste. They wander around for the best taste with their tongues.
cnd23:2.5: After they get the sour taste, they ask for no sour taste, and ask for sourness
cnd23:2.6: after getting no sourness; ...(omitted) sweetness ...(omitted); bitterness,
cnd23:2.7: spicy, salty, alkali; when they get the sour taste, they look for the
cnd23:2.8: astringency, when they get the astringency, look for the sour taste; ...pleasant
cnd23:2.10: ...cold..., hot. They are greedy, craving, tied, fascinated, tainted, attached,
cnd23:2.11: fixed, in the desire for taste, being obstructed. For the alone-enlightened
cnd23:2.12: person, the taste and thirst and love have been cut off, ..., he eats food after
cnd23:2.13: inspecting it logically: "Neither for pleasure, nor for intoxication, not for a
cnd23:2.14: good figure, not for dignity, but for the survival of this body, to stop harm,
cnd23:2.15: and to support the Brahma. In this way, I will repel the previous feelings, not
cnd23:2.16: arouse new feelings, be healthy, without fault, and live in peace."
cnd23:3.1: For example, if he applies oil to the sore, it is only for the purpose of
cnd23:3.2: growing (flesh), or, if he applies oil to the axle, only for the purpose of
cnd23:3.3: transporting goods, or, if he eats his son's meat it is only for the purpose of
cnd23:3.4: passing through the desert. In the same way, the alone-enlightened person eats
cnd23:3.5: food after introspection: "Neither for pleasure...." He is separated from the
cnd23:3.6: craving of taste, quit, departed, left, been freed, and being unbound, he lives
cnd23:4.1: "Those who are not greedy," greed is called craving, which is greed, lust,
cnd23:4.2: acquiescence, conformity, joy, desire, obsession, taking, contaminated,
cnd23:4.3: disturbance, fraud, (reincarnation) root cause, (bitter) fertility, tailoring
cnd23:4.4: (greed), net, river, bondage, rope, attachment, accumulation, companionship,
cnd23:4.5: desire, intimate interaction, forest, jungle, love, expectation, relationship,
cnd23:4.6: desire for form, desire for sounds, desire for smells, desire for tastes, desire
cnd23:4.7: for touches, desire for acquisition, desire for wealth, desire for sons, desire
cnd23:4.8: for life, the state of desire, hope, prayer, greedy appearance, possessing
cnd23:4.9: greed, inquiring for profit, illegal greed, improper greed, hope, envy, desire
cnd23:4.10: for desire, desire for nothingness, desire for form, formless thirst,
cnd23:4.11: extinguished thirst, form thirst, sound thirst, smell thirst, taste thirst,
cnd23:4.12: touch thirst, dhamma thirst, torrent, harness, binding, clinging, obstacles,
cnd23:4.13: covering, defilements, potential trends of troubles, entanglement, vines,
cnd23:4.14: stinginess, suffering roots, causes of suffering, occurrence of suffering,
cnd23:4.15: magical nets, magical hooks, magical food, the realm of the devil, the residence
cnd23:4.16: of the devil, the state of the devil, the bondage of the devil, the river of
cnd23:4.17: thirst, the net of thirst, the rope of thirst, the sea of thirst, craving,
cnd23:4.18: greed, and the root of unwholesomeness. That greed and thirst have been cut off
cnd23:4.19: for the enlightened one, ..., therefore, the alone-enlightened ones are the ones
cnd23:5.1: "Those who don't nurture other people, second-order beggars": "Those who don't
cnd23:5.2: raise other people," For that alone-enlightened person, only nurture themselves,
cnd23:6.1: "Those who do not nurture others, those who already know,
cnd23:6.2: Those who have been tamed, those who have settled in the core,
cnd23:6.3: Those who have exhausted their troubles and those who have eliminated their faults,
cnd23:6.4: I say he is a Brāhmaṇa."
cnd23:7.1: "Those who do not nurture others, second-time beggars": The alone-enlightened
cnd23:7.2: person puts on his clothes in the early afternoon, takes the mantle, has guarded
cnd23:7.3: his body, has guarded his words, has guarded his heart, and his mind has
cnd23:7.4: emerged, with the protection of the roots, in order to enter a village or town
cnd23:7.5: as a beggar, those who have their eyes down and behave adequately, go from home
cnd23:7.6: to home without crossing to beg for alms.
cnd23:8.1: "Do not be bound in the center of a family": the mind is bound in two ways:
cnd23:8.2: making oneself humble, and others stand noble while the heart is bound, or
cnd23:8.3: making others stand humble, and oneself stand noble and the heart is bound. How
cnd23:8.4: to make yourself humble and make others stand up noble and flatter others?
cnd23:8.5: (Thinking:) "You are very helpful to me, I rely on you to get clothes, food,
cnd23:8.6: shelter, the needs of patients, medical necessities, and anyone who gives or
cnd23:8.7: wants to do they think I am dependent on you, those who are regarded as you, all
cnd23:8.8: my previous names from my parents have disappeared to me, because you are known
cnd23:8.9: as those who frequent (someone's) home like that; those who often visit
cnd23:8.10: (someone's) home." This is to make oneself humble, to make others stand noble,
cnd23:9.1: How to make others humble and make oneself stand noble and be restrained?
cnd23:9.2: (Thinking:) "I am a good person to you. Because of me, you turn to the Buddha,
cnd23:9.3: to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha, become (as) those who are free from killing,
cnd23:9.4: those who have not given and take, those who have not given, and those who are
cnd23:9.5: free from lying, and those who (do not) drink spirits, fruit wine, and wine, I
cnd23:9.6: will give you instructions, give me a lot of questions, I will explain uposatha,
cnd23:9.7: and build temples. However, after you abandon me, you respect, honor, and revere
cnd23:9.8: other people." This is to make others humble, and make oneself stand noble, and
cnd23:9.9: the heart is bound. For those who pity for friends and confidants, their
cnd23:9.10: interests are lost and the heart is bound.
cnd23:10.1: "Do not be fettered in the center of one family": The mind of the
cnd23:10.2: alone-enlightened person is not fettered by the obstacles of the family; the
cnd23:10.3: heart is not fettered by the obstacles of the group (people); ...the residence;
cnd23:11.1: <em>152 : After giving up the five covers of the mind,
cnd23:11.3: After cutting off love and aversion, independent,
cnd23:11.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:11.5: <em>152 : After giving up the five covers of the mind,
cnd23:11.7: After cutting off love and aversion, independent,
cnd23:11.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:11.9: <em>152 : After giving up the five covers of the mind,
cnd23:11.11: After cutting off love and aversion, independent,
cnd23:11.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:11.13: <em>152 : After giving up the five covers of the mind,
cnd23:11.15: After cutting off love and aversion, independent,
cnd23:11.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:12.1: "Giving up the five covers of the mind": The one who is alone-enlightened, the
cnd23:12.2: desire being obliterated, after giving up, after abandoning, after being driven
cnd23:12.3: away, after finishing, after making it go to non-existence, the malicious
cnd23:12.4: cover..., sleeping cover..., regret cover..., doubt cover..., after giving up,
cnd23:12.5: after abandoning, after being driven away, after finishing, after making it go
cnd23:12.6: to non-existence, after leaving desire, leaving unwholesome dhammas, after
cnd23:12.7: entering into the joy and happiness of the first jhāna, after separation.
cnd23:13.1: "After having expelled all defilements": Greed is the heart that follows the
cnd23:13.2: defilements; anger is the heart that follows the defilements; ignorance is the
cnd23:13.3: heart that follows the defilements; anger..., resentment.... "After expelling
cnd23:13.4: all the defilements": After expelling all the defilements, after removing, after
cnd23:13.5: abandoning, after being expelled, after finishing, and making them go to
cnd23:14.1: "The non-dependent one cuts off love and aversion": "The non-dependent" has two
cnd23:14.2: types of dependence: the dependence of craving and the dependence of seeing....
cnd23:14.3: "Love," there are two types of love: the love of thirsting and the love of
cnd23:14.4: seeing.... "Aversion," that is the state of anger, hostility, disgust, aversion,
cnd23:14.5: evil, anger of the heart, aggrieved, angry state, abusive, irritated, irritated
cnd23:14.6: state, hostility, brutal anger, rage, displeased heart. "The unrestrained one
cnd23:14.7: cuts off the love and the aversion": The thirsty love and the seeing love and
cnd23:14.8: the aversion, to the alone-enlightened one, is cut off, severed, after
cnd23:14.9: abandoning, after driving away, after finishing, making it come to
cnd23:14.10: non-existence; there are those who do not adhere to the eyes, those who do not
cnd23:14.11: adhere to the ears..., the unstuck, the unclinging, the person who does not turn
cnd23:14.12: his heart toward (these things). He who has left, has departed, has been
cnd23:14.13: liberated, has been separated from bondage, he lives with an unrestrained heart.
cnd23:15.1: <em>153 : After putting aside happiness and suffering,
cnd23:15.2: And the joy and worry before (previously),
cnd23:15.3: After getting purity, peace, and calm,
cnd23:15.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:15.5: <em>153 : After putting aside happiness and suffering,
cnd23:15.6: And the joy and worry before (previously),
cnd23:15.7: After getting purity, peace, and calm,
cnd23:15.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:15.9: <em>153 : After putting aside happiness and suffering,
cnd23:15.10: And the joy and worry before (previously),
cnd23:15.11: After getting purity, peace, and calm,
cnd23:15.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:15.13: <em>153 : After putting aside happiness and suffering,
cnd23:15.14: And the joy and worry before (previously),
cnd23:15.15: After getting purity, peace, and calm,
cnd23:15.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:16.1: "After putting aside happiness and suffering, and the joy and sorrow before":
cnd23:16.2: The alone-enlightened one who renounced pleasure and sorrow, and with the
cnd23:16.3: extinction of the joy and sorrow previously, enters and lives without suffering,
cnd23:16.4: not suffering, or happiness in the calm of the fourth jhāna.
cnd23:17.1: "After gaining purity, peace, and calm": "Calm," that is the peace, lack of
cnd23:17.2: caring, onlooking, the cessation of the mind, the equality of the mind, the
cnd23:17.3: peaceful state of the mind, the neutral state of the mind in the fourth jhāna.
cnd23:17.4: "Calm" means the mind's cessation, stability, undistracted, stable mind, smooth
cnd23:17.5: mind, calm (stopping), fixed root, steady force, and concentration. The peace
cnd23:17.6: and calm in the fourth jhāna are pure, completely pure, all pure, purified,
cnd23:17.7: non-filthy, free from defilements, malleable, suitable for work, standing still,
cnd23:17.8: and immutable. "After getting purity, peace, calm": The peace in the fourth
cnd23:17.9: jhāna, After calm is obtained, after obtaining, after possessing, after
cnd23:18.1: <em>154 : Those whose vitality has been activated in order to obtain the highest interests,
cnd23:18.2: Those who do not shrink from their hearts, those who do not slack in their behaviors,
cnd23:18.3: Those who are firm, hardworking, with fortitude and strength,
cnd23:18.4: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:18.5: <em>154 : Those whose vitality has been activated in order to obtain the highest interests,
cnd23:18.6: Those who do not shrink from their hearts, those who do not slack in their behaviors,
cnd23:18.7: Those who are firm, hardworking, with fortitude and strength,
cnd23:18.8: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:18.9: <em>154 : Those whose vitality has been activated in order to obtain the highest interests,
cnd23:18.10: Those who do not shrink from their hearts, those who do not slack in their behaviors,
cnd23:18.11: Those who are firm, hardworking, with fortitude and strength,
cnd23:18.12: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:18.13: <em>154 : Those whose vitality has been activated in order to obtain the highest interests,
cnd23:18.14: Those who do not shrink from their hearts, those who do not slack in their behaviors,
cnd23:18.15: Those who are firm, hardworking, with fortitude and strength,
cnd23:18.16: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:19.1: "Those whose vitality has been activated for the gain of the highest interest":
cnd23:19.2: The highest interest is called non-living, Nibbāna, which is the cessation of
cnd23:19.3: all actions, the cessation of all attachments, the extinction of craving, greed,
cnd23:19.4: annihilation, Nibbāna. In order to obtain, receive, reach, contact, and testify
cnd23:19.5: for the highest interests, live in the abandonment of unwholesome dhammas, for
cnd23:19.6: the fullness of good Dhamma, vitality has been activated, fortitude, firm
cnd23:19.7: efforts, and non-negligence of the responsibility of good Dhamma.
cnd23:20.1: "Those who do not shrink in their minds and do not slacken their actions": The
cnd23:20.2: one who is alone-enlightened arouses vitality, devotes himself, and works hard
cnd23:20.3: for the evil and unwholesome dhammas that have not arisen; for the evil and
cnd23:20.4: unwholesome dhammas that have arisen, to give up... (omitted), for the arising
cnd23:20.5: of the unborn good Dhamma..., for the survival, not disappearing, increase,
cnd23:20.6: expansion, and completion of the practice of the good Dhamma that has arisen,
cnd23:20.7: desire, hard work, vitality, dedication, diligence.
cnd23:21.2: "I am willing to leave only skin, tendons, and bones;
cnd23:21.3: If the flesh and blood of the body is dried up,
cnd23:21.4: As long as people's perseverance, human strength,
cnd23:21.5: Human vitality, and human efforts should (persist)
cnd23:21.7: There will be no cessation of vitality."
cnd23:22.2: Nor go out of my residence,
cnd23:22.3: Will not cause the thigh to fall (lying down),
cnd23:22.4: While the arrow of thirst is not be removed."
cnd23:23.1: "As long as my heart is not freed from the troubles by not clinging,
cnd23:23.2: I will not break this cross-legged (posture)!"
cnd23:24.1: "As long as my mind is not free from the troubles with non-clinging, I will not
cnd23:25.1: "I will not go down from the scripture... (omitted), I will not go out from the
cnd23:25.2: residence..., I will not go out from the half-roofed house..., the tall
cnd23:25.3: building, the flat house, cave, hut, heavy pavilion, observation deck, round
cnd23:25.4: house, shed, lecture hall, tent..., as long as my heart is not free from all
cnd23:25.5: defilements without clinging, I will not go out from the tree."
cnd23:26.1: "Just before this noon, I will obtain, fully obtain, attain, reach, and testify
cnd23:26.2: to the Holy Dhamma." He is dedicated and diligent, so he is also a person who
cnd23:26.3: does not shrink from his heart and who does not slacken his behavior. "Just at
cnd23:26.4: noon... (omitted), in the evening..., before eating, after eating, before the
cnd23:26.5: night, the night, after the night, at the time of death, at the time of the
cnd23:26.6: white moon, during the rainy season, in the winter, summer, youth, adolescence,
cnd23:26.7: middle-age, old age..., I will acquire, fully acquire, attain, reach, and
cnd23:26.8: testify about the Holy Dhamma." He is dedicated and diligent, and so is also a
cnd23:26.9: person who does not shrink in heart and does not slack in behavior.
cnd23:27.1: "Strong hard work, fortitude, and strength": The alone-enlightened one is a
cnd23:27.2: strong holder of good Dhamma, in good deeds in body, in words, good intentions,
cnd23:27.3: generosity and sharing, precepts and prohibitions, deeds of filial piety to his
cnd23:27.4: mother, deeds of filial piety to his father, respect to Samaṇas, respect to
cnd23:27.5: Brāhmaṇas, respect to the oldest person in the family, certain holders who live
cnd23:27.6: up to the highest virtues [DN.30]. "With fortitude, and a strength-sufficient
cnd23:27.7: person," the alone-enlightened person has, fully has, reached, fully reached,
cnd23:27.8: possessed, fully possessed fortitude, strength, vitality, hard work, wisdom.
cnd23:28.1: <em>155 : Those who sit alone, do not ignore jhāna,
cnd23:28.3: Having explored the misery in existence,
cnd23:28.4: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:28.5: <em>155 : Those who sit alone, do not ignore jhāna,
cnd23:28.7: Having explored the misery in existence,
cnd23:28.8: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:28.9: <em>155 : Those who sit alone, do not ignore jhāna,
cnd23:28.11: Having explored the misery in existence,
cnd23:28.12: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:28.13: <em>155 : Those who sit alone, do not ignore jhāna,
cnd23:28.15: Having explored the misery in existence,
cnd23:28.16: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:29.1: "Sit alone, do not ignore jhāna": The alone-enlightened person is a person who
cnd23:29.2: is willing to sit alone, a person who loves to sit alone, and a practitioner of
cnd23:29.3: inner cessation, does not despise jhāna, has the observer, and increases the
cnd23:29.4: vacant house, the meditator, the jhāna-loving person, the singular practitioner,
cnd23:29.5: and the admirer of their own interests, are those who sit alone. "Do not ignore
cnd23:29.6: jhāna," the one who is enlightened in two ways doesn't neglect jhāna: for the
cnd23:29.7: emergence of the first jhāna that has not arisen, to become harnessed, strongly
cnd23:29.8: harnessed, fully harnessed; or the second jhāna..., or the third jhāna..., or
cnd23:30.1: Or, the first jhāna has arisen, practice and more practice, or the second jhāna
cnd23:30.2: has arisen..., or the third jhāna..., or the fourth jhāna has been born..., so
cnd23:30.3: that he does not ignore jhāna.
cnd23:31.1: "A person who always follows the Dhamma": Four mindfulnesses... (omitted)...,
cnd23:31.2: the eight holy paths are called Dhamma. What is the path? Correct path,
cnd23:31.3: following the path, the path that is not inverted, the path of the meaning, the
cnd23:31.4: path of the Dhamma, the completeness of the precepts, the guardian of the roots,
cnd23:31.5: knowing the right amount of diet, sobriety, the mind and the right knowledge,
cnd23:31.6: these are called following the Dhamma. "Follow the Dhamma in the Dhamma": In the
cnd23:31.7: Dhamma always; eternal time; always constant; continuous; uninterrupted;
cnd23:31.8: successively; like water waves arising without intervals; they are continuously
cnd23:31.9: accompanied by making them reach; before noon, noon, first night, midnight, and
cnd23:31.10: late night; settle in the dark moon, bright moon, rainy season, winter, summer;
cnd23:31.11: in youth, middle age, old age, he walks, lives, acts, goes on, guards, and
cnd23:32.1: "I have explored the misery in all existence": "All actions are impermanent,"
cnd23:32.2: ..., "all actions are suffering"..., "all dhammas are selfless"..., "any
cnd23:32.3: collection of dhammas is an extinction of dhammas." I have probed misery in all
cnd23:33.1: <em>156 : Those who wish for the extermination of love, those who do not let go,
cnd23:33.2: Those who are wise, those who learn more, those who have mindfulness,
cnd23:33.3: The perceiver, decider, and diligent one of the Dhamma
cnd23:33.4: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:33.5: <em>156 : Those who wish for the extermination of love, those who do not let go,
cnd23:33.6: Those who are wise, those who learn more, those who have mindfulness,
cnd23:33.7: The perceiver, decider, and diligent one of the Dhamma
cnd23:33.8: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:33.9: <em>156 : Those who wish for the extermination of love, those who do not let go,
cnd23:33.10: Those who are wise, those who learn more, those who have mindfulness,
cnd23:33.11: The perceiver, decider, and diligent one of the Dhamma
cnd23:33.12: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:33.13: <em>156 : Those who wish for the extermination of love, those who do not let go,
cnd23:33.14: Those who are wise, those who learn more, those who have mindfulness,
cnd23:33.15: The perceiver, decider, and diligent one of the Dhamma
cnd23:33.16: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:34.1: "Hope for the extinction of the thirst for love, the one who does not let go":
cnd23:34.2: The thirst of "thirst for love"..., the end of the death, the end of ignorance,
cnd23:34.3: the end of interest, the end of rebirth, the end of rotation, the end of being,
cnd23:34.4: the end of reincarnation, the end of the cycle, eager, and supplicating. "The
cnd23:34.5: one who does not let go," the one who is alone is a respectful actor, a regular
cnd23:34.6: actor... (omitted) in good Dhamma, not neglecting responsibility, the one who
cnd23:35.1: "The wise, the hearer (of learning), the thoughtful": "The wise one (not the
cnd23:35.2: deaf and mute)," the one who is enlightened alone is the wise, the enlightened,
cnd23:35.3: the distinguished, and the wise. "The one who hears more," the one who is alone
cnd23:35.4: aware is the one who hears more, remembers what has been heard, accumulates what
cnd23:35.5: has been heard, all that which has goodness in the beginning, goodness in the
cnd23:35.6: middle, and goodness in the end; correct meaning and correct words, proclaiming
cnd23:35.7: that there is only a complete and pure Brāhmaṇa Dhamma. Such Dhamma has been
cnd23:35.8: heard, remembered, recited, observed with the heart, and penetrated by seeing
cnd23:35.9: the good. "Those who have mindfulness" are the one who is alone-enlightened, and
cnd23:35.10: have the highest level of thought and intelligence. They are the memorizers and
cnd23:35.11: recallers who did it a long time ago and said it a long time ago.
cnd23:36.1: "The Dhamma-seeker, the decider, and the diligent": The Dhamma-understander is
cnd23:36.2: called wisdom, which is wisdom, understanding, simple selection, investigation,
cnd23:36.3: discernment, recognition, discrimination, close observation, inspection, learned
cnd23:36.4: virtuous wisdom, proficiency, cleverness, study, reflection, review,
cnd23:36.5: contemplation, examination, general comprehensive wisdom, vipassanā, right
cnd23:36.6: knowledge, stabbing rod, wisdom root, wisdom sword, wisdom palace, wisdom
cnd23:36.7: brightness, wisdom light, no delusion, choice of dhamma, right view. The one who
cnd23:36.8: is alone-enlightened is the perceiver of the Dhamma, the knower of the Dhamma,
cnd23:36.9: the measurer of the Dhamma, the judge of the Dhamma, the clearer of the Dhamma:
cnd23:36.10: "all actions are impermanent," ...the clearer of the Dhamma. Or, for the
cnd23:36.11: alone-enlightened one, he is the enlightened person of the realm, the
cnd23:36.12: enlightened person of the place, the enlightened person of the interest, the
cnd23:36.13: enlightened person of the rebirth, the enlightened person of the revolving, the
cnd23:36.14: enlightened person of being, the enlightened person of rotation, the enlightened
cnd23:36.15: person of reincarnation. Or, the one who is enlightened is the one who lives in
cnd23:36.16: the ultimate (boundary), the one who lives in the world, the one who lives in
cnd23:36.17: the ultimate, the one who lives in the ultimate place of interest, the one who
cnd23:36.18: lives in the final life, the one who stands at the end of the incarnation, the
cnd23:36.19: one who stands at the end, the one who stands at the end of reincarnation, the
cnd23:36.20: one who stands at the end of the cycle, the one who stands at the end, those who
cnd23:36.21: gather (the last body) at the end, those who hold the last self-enlightenment.
cnd23:37.1: "This is his last, this is the last gathering (body),
cnd23:37.2: The cycle of life and death, without his rebirth."
cnd23:38.1: For this reason, the enlightened person is the perceiver of the Dhamma. The
cnd23:38.2: "decider," the Four Holy Paths are called the decision, and the "one with the
cnd23:38.3: Four Holy Paths" is the decider. He has reached, fully reached, arrived, and has
cnd23:38.4: given testimony to the decision. "Diligence," diligence is called vitality,
cnd23:38.5: which is the stimulation of the vitality of the heart, diligence, hard work,
cnd23:38.6: courage, fortitude, effort, firmness, a state of courage without relaxation, a
cnd23:38.7: state of desire not to give up, and the state of not neglecting responsibility,
cnd23:38.8: the support of responsibility, vitality, root of vitality, power of vitality,
cnd23:38.9: right diligence. The enlightened person arrives (has), fully arrived, entered,
cnd23:38.10: fully entered, possessed, fully possessed, possesses this diligence. Therefore,
cnd23:38.11: the alone-enlightened person is a diligent person.
cnd23:39.1: <em>157 : Like the lion not afraid of sounds,
cnd23:39.2: Like the wind not stuck in the net,
cnd23:39.3: Like a red lotus, one which is not stained with water,
cnd23:39.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:39.5: <em>157 : Like the lion not afraid of sounds,
cnd23:39.6: Like the wind not stuck in the net,
cnd23:39.7: Like a red lotus, one which is not stained with water,
cnd23:39.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:39.9: <em>157 : Like the lion not afraid of sounds,
cnd23:39.10: Like the wind not stuck in the net,
cnd23:39.11: Like a red lotus, one which is not stained with water,
cnd23:39.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:39.13: <em>157 : Like the lion not afraid of sounds,
cnd23:39.14: Like the wind not stuck in the net,
cnd23:39.15: Like a red lotus, one which is not stained with water,
cnd23:39.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:40.1: "Like a lion is not afraid of sounds": Like a lion, the Beast King, is one who
cnd23:40.2: is not afraid of sound, who is has no fear of sound, who is not frightened, who
cnd23:40.3: is not suspicious, who is not timid, who does not run away, the one who is not
cnd23:40.4: afraid of the sound, those who live where they have given up their terror and
cnd23:40.5: fear, and have left the state of having body hair standing on end.
cnd23:41.1: "As the wind is not adhered to the net": "Wind," east wind, west wind, north
cnd23:41.2: wind, south wind, dusty wind, dust-free wind, cold wind, hot wind, small wind,
cnd23:41.3: extreme wind, swift wind, cross wind, golden-winged bird wind, palm leaf wind,
cnd23:41.4: fan wind. Nets are called rope nets. As the wind is not caught by the net, is
cnd23:41.5: stuck, not bound, not captured, not tied, and not to be bound by the whole
cnd23:41.6: world, there are two types of nets in the same way: thirsting nets and seeing
cnd23:41.7: nets...(omitted). To the alone-enlightened one, the net of thirst has been cut
cnd23:41.8: off, the seeing net has been cut off, in the state where the thirst net has been
cnd23:41.9: cut off, the seeing net has been cut off, the alone-enlightened person is not
cnd23:41.10: stuck in form, not adhered to sound... (omitted), not adhered to, captured,
cnd23:41.11: tied, or bound to the world in the dhammas that are seen, heard, sensed, and can
cnd23:41.12: be known. He has left, has been freed, has been separated from the bondage, he
cnd23:42.1: "As the red lotus is not stained with water": Red lotus is called red lotus, and
cnd23:42.2: water (toyaṃ) is called water (udakaṃ). As the red lotus is not stained with
cnd23:42.3: water, is not strongly stained, or is not closely stained, it is no longer
cnd23:42.4: stained, no longer strongly stained, no longer stained closely; the same, there
cnd23:42.5: are two types of adhesion: the adhesion of thirsting and the adhesion of
cnd23:42.6: seeing.... For the one who is alone-enlightened, the adhesion of desire has been
cnd23:42.7: cut off...(omitted), in seeing, hearing, feeling, and being aware of the dhammas
cnd23:42.8: are not stained, not strongly stained,..., has been separated, has left, has
cnd23:42.9: been liberated, has been separated from the bondage, and dwells with an
cnd23:43.1: <em>158 : Like the lion, beast king, is one with strong teeth,
cnd23:43.2: A walker after overcoming and victory,
cnd23:43.3: One should use the border (distant) dwellings,
cnd23:43.5: <em>158 : Like the lion, beast king, is one with strong teeth,
cnd23:43.6: A walker after overcoming and victory,
cnd23:43.7: One should use the border (distant) dwellings,
cnd23:43.9: <em>158 : Like the lion, beast king, is one with strong teeth,
cnd23:43.10: A walker after overcoming and victory,
cnd23:43.11: One should use the border (distant) dwellings,
cnd23:43.13: <em>158 : Like the lion, beast king, is one with strong teeth,
cnd23:43.14: A walker after overcoming and victory,
cnd23:43.15: One should use the border (distant) dwellings,
cnd23:44.1: "As the lion, beast king, is one with powerful teeth, a walker who overcomes and
cnd23:44.2: has victory": As the lion and a beast king is one with powerful teeth and a
cnd23:44.3: weapon with teeth, it wins, defeats, overwhelms, and ends all the animals that
cnd23:44.4: fall into the animal category, after crushing, walking, dwelling, acting, going
cnd23:44.5: on, guarding, surviving. That alone-enlightened person is also a powerful person
cnd23:44.6: with wisdom, and one who uses wisdom as a weapon. He beats with wisdom among all
cnd23:44.7: the living, he defeated, overwhelmed, terminated, crushed, and walked, stayed,
cnd23:44.8: acted, went on, guarded, and survived.
cnd23:45.1: "One should use border (distant) dwellings": As the lion and beast king enters
cnd23:45.2: the forest, the wild forest, walks, lives, ..., the alone-enlightened person
cnd23:45.3: will also use the forest, the wild forest, and the border dwelling (reclining
cnd23:45.4: place): low voice, quiet, away from the atmosphere, living alone, suitable for
cnd23:45.5: sitting alone; he walks alone, stands alone, sits alone, lies alone, enters the
cnd23:45.6: village alone for alms, advance alone, returns alone, sits alone in a quiet
cnd23:45.7: place, performs alone, walks, lives, moves, goes on, guards, and survives alone.
cnd23:46.1: <em>159 : At the right time, cultivating kindness,
cnd23:46.2: Calm (equanimity), compassion, and joy, for freedom,
cnd23:46.3: Not opposed by all the world,
cnd23:46.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:46.5: <em>159 : At the right time, cultivating kindness,
cnd23:46.6: Calm (equanimity), compassion, and joy, for freedom,
cnd23:46.7: Not opposed by all the world,
cnd23:46.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.

cnd23:46.10: Calm (equanimity), compassion, and joy, for freedom,
cnd23:46.11: Not opposed by all the world,
cnd23:46.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:46.13: <em>159 : At the right time, cultivating kindness,
cnd23:46.14: Calm (equanimity), compassion, and joy, for freedom,
cnd23:46.15: Not opposed by all the world,
cnd23:46.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:47.1: "At the right time, cultivating kindness, calm, compassion, and joy, for
cnd23:47.2: liberation (the brahmavihāras)": the alone-enlightened person fills one side
cnd23:47.3: (direction) with a heart of compassion and lives, and like that a second side,
cnd23:47.4: and the third, and the fourth, like this the up and down (directions),
cnd23:47.5: horizontally, everywhere, to everything as to yourself, with a heart of
cnd23:47.6: compassion, with a heart of vastness, excellence, immeasurable, no resentment,
cnd23:47.7: and no malice, filling all the world and dwelling afterwards. Walk with
cnd23:47.8: sorrow...(omitted,) walk with joy..., walk with peace and live in one side, ...
cnd23:47.9: the heart that is vast, outstanding, immeasurable, free of resentment, with no
cnd23:48.1: "Not opposed by all worldly opponents": In the state of being practiced in
cnd23:48.2: compassion, all beings in the east will not disobey, those in the south will not
cnd23:48.3: disobey, and those in the west will not disobey; all beings in the north are not
cnd23:48.4: against them, all beings in the middle of the east are not against them, and all
cnd23:48.5: beings in the middle of the south are not against them, and all beings in the
cnd23:48.6: middle of the west are not against them; all beings in the middle of the north
cnd23:48.7: are not against them, all beings below are not against them, all beings above
cnd23:48.8: are not against them, all beings in all directions are not against them. They
cnd23:48.9: are not against them in a state of sadness that has been practiced..., in a
cnd23:48.10: state of joy that has been practiced..., in a state of calm that has been
cnd23:48.11: practiced, all beings in the east are not against them... (omitted) in all
cnd23:48.12: directions are not against them. "Not to be opposed by all worldly opponents":
cnd23:48.13: Not to be denied by all worldly opponents, hostiles, angry people, and
cnd23:49.1: <em>160 : After abandoning greed, anger and ignorance,
cnd23:49.3: Those who are not afraid at the end of their lives,
cnd23:49.4: Should walk alone like a rhinoceros.

cnd23:49.15: Those who are not afraid at the end of their lives,

cnd23:50.1: "After quitting greed, anger, and ignorance": "Greed," that is greed....
cnd23:50.2: "Anger," that is the anger and hostility of the heart.... "Ignorance," the
cnd23:50.3: ignorance of suffering.... "After renunciation of greed, anger, and ignorance":
cnd23:50.4: The alone-enlightened person whose greed, anger, and ignorance, after cessation,
cnd23:50.5: after abandoning, after being driven away, after finishing, and making them to
cnd23:51.1: "After breaking the knots": There are ten types of knots: desire knot, hate
cnd23:51.2: knot, conceit knot, see knot, doubt knot, covetous knot, have greed knot,
cnd23:51.3: jealous knot, miserly knot, and ignorant knot. "After breaking the knots": After
cnd23:51.4: the ten types of knots are cut, broken, completely broken, after being broken,
cnd23:51.5: after being driven away, after finishing, and making them go to non-existence.
cnd23:52.1: "Those who are not afraid when their lives end": The one who is alone is, at the
cnd23:52.2: end of life, not afraid, those who do not fear, those who are not frightened,
cnd23:53.1: <em>161 : They get close and serve (you) for reasons of (their own) interest;
cnd23:53.2: Friends with no motive are hard to get today.
cnd23:53.3: Impure people have the wisdom of their own interests,
cnd23:53.4: So one should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:53.5: <em>161 : They get close and serve (you) for reasons of (their own) interest;
cnd23:53.6: Friends with no motive are hard to get today.
cnd23:53.7: Impure people have the wisdom of their own interests,
cnd23:53.8: So one should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:53.9: <em>161 : They get close and serve (you) for reasons of (their own) interest;
cnd23:53.10: Friends with no motive are hard to get today.
cnd23:53.11: Impure people have the wisdom of their own interests,
cnd23:53.12: So one should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:53.13: <em>161 : They get close and serve (you) for reasons of (their own) interest;
cnd23:53.14: Friends with no motive are hard to get today.
cnd23:53.15: Impure people have the wisdom of their own interests,
cnd23:53.16: So one should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd23:54.1: "They get close to and serve for reasons of interest": For the reasons of their
cnd23:54.2: own interests, for the interests of others, for the interests of both, for the
cnd23:54.3: reasons of current interests, for the interests of the past, for the reasons of
cnd23:54.4: the highest interests, They are close, dedicated (totally close), serve,
cnd23:54.5: associate (to serve down), communicate (totally serve), and follow (toward
cnd23:55.1: "Friends for no reason (with no motive) are hard to get today": "Friends," there
cnd23:55.2: are two types of friends: friends at home and friends (away) from home
cnd23:55.3: (monastics). What is a friend at home? Here, a certain category of people give
cnd23:55.4: what is hard to give, charity, do what is hard to do, forgive (tolerate) what is
cnd23:55.5: hard to forgive, he tells (you his) secret, keeps (your) secret, and never
cnd23:55.6: forsakes you in disasters, he is the one who would give his life for (you)
cnd23:55.7: [DN.31], he does not contempt when (you) are exhausted, this is a friend at
cnd23:56.1: What is a friend (away) from home (monastic)? Here, the bhikkhu is lovable,
cnd23:56.2: agreeable, respectable, admirable, an interpreter, tolerant of other people's
cnd23:56.3: words, and an esoteric talker (leader). He does not encourage [AN.7.37] and
cnd23:56.4: persuade on non-increasing precepts. He persuades him in the four-mindfulness
cnd23:56.5: practice effort, in ...(omitted) the eight sacred paths of practice, this is a
cnd23:57.1: "Friends without a reason are hard to get today": These two types of friends,
cnd23:57.2: without a reason (motive), are hard to get.
cnd23:58.1: "Impure people have the wisdom of their own interests": "The wisdom of their own
cnd23:58.2: interests," For their own interests, their own causes, their own reasons, their
cnd23:58.3: own motives, they get close, ..., deeds, good deeds, respect, inquiries and
cnd23:58.4: questions all the time. "The impure person," "having impure body kamma" is an
cnd23:58.5: impure person; "having impure mental kamma" is an impure person; impure
cnd23:58.6: killing... (omitted); taking without being given; deceit, vulgar language,
cnd23:58.7: greed, pure malice, wrong views, impure intention, impure hope, having impure
cnd23:58.8: desires is an "impure person;" impure is inferior, despicable, low, inferior
cnd23:59.1: "Should walk alone like a rhinoceros": "Alone," the alone-enlightened person
cnd23:59.2: named as a bhikkhu alone.... "Should do," there are eight types of
cnd23:59.3: activities.... "Like a rhinoceros," the rhinoceros is truly unique....
cnd23:60.1: The description of the Rhinoceros Sutta is completed.
cnd23:61.2: As well as Dhotaka and Upasīva, Nanda and Hemaka,
cnd23:61.3: The two Todeyya and Kappa, and the wise Jatukanṇị̄,
cnd23:61.4: As well as Bhadrāvudha and Udaya, and the Brāhmaṇa Posāla,
cnd23:61.5: the clever Mogharāja, and the great rishi Piṅgiya,
cnd23:61.6: To these sixteen, as the teaching of Brāhmaṇa.
cnd23:61.7: As explained by the other shore road, there are only so many,
cnd23:61.8: The explanation of the rhinoceros sutta is the same,
cnd23:61.9: The two types of explanations should be known, and the difference has been completed."
